Tag 1: Ensure supports are installed min 600mm from penetrations through slabs or walls where insulation is required

Name: Measure accurate length & use appropriate copper tube cutter to ensure a clean square cut
Tag 1: Measure accurate length & use appropriate copper tube cutter to ensure a clean square cut.

Name: Ream inside & outside of cut w/ reaming tool/file & clean w/ abrasive cloth
Tag 1: Ream inside & outside of cut with reaming tool or file & clean with abrasive cloth

Name: Ensure pipe is pushed in to full insertion depth. For brass to copper joints ensure flux is applied prior to insertion
Tag 1: Ensure pipe is pushed in to full insertion depth. For brass to copper joints ensure flux is applied prior to insertion

Name: Weld joint w/ correct amount of heat ensuring capillary action throughout & correct % silver solder used
Tag 1: Weld joint with correct amount of heat ensuring capillary action throughout & correct % silver solder is used. (min1.8)

Name: Allow joint to cool naturally. Shock cooling may stress/crack the joint. Wipe off any left over flux residue
Tag 1: Allow joint to cool naturally. Shock cooling may stress or crack the joint. Wipe off any left over flux residue

Name: Inspect the joint for soundness & pin holes
Tag 1: Inspect the joint for soundness and pin holes

Name: When installing non-potable services ensure pipework is not installed within 100 mm of any parallel drinking service pipework
Tag 1: When installing non-potable services ensure pipework is not installed within 100 mm of any parallel drinking service pipework

Name: Select appropriate tool for brand being used. Only use batteries supplied w/ tool & w/ not less than 40% charge
Tag 1: Select appropriate tool for brand being used. Only use batteries supplied with tool & with not less than 40% charge

Name: Use appropriate copper tube cutter to ensure a clean square cut
Tag 1: Use appropriate copper tube cutter to ensure a clean square cut.

Name: Ensure cut end is clean & free from any scratches/damage such as dents/deformity
Tag 1: Ensure cut end is clean and free from any scratches or damage such as dents or deformity.

Name: Ensure that the internal & external tube end is completely free from burrs/sharp edges by using a deburring tool
Tag 1: Ensure that the internal and external tube end is completely free from burrs or sharp edges by using a deburring tool

Name: Before inserting the tube, check O-Rings for correct placement & that they are free of damage/debris
Tag 1: Before inserting the tube, check O-Rings for correct placement and that they are free of damage or debris.

Name: Apply insertion depth mark w/ pen to the tube prior to insertion into the fitting.
Tag 1: Apply insertion depth mark with pen to the tube prior to insertion into the fitting.

Name: Tube to be inserted Parallel into the fitting , ensuring the insertion mark is visible & in line w/ fitting end
Tag 1: Tube to be inserted Parallel into the fitting , ensuring the insertion mark is visible and in line with fitting end

Name: Place jaw over the fitting, correctly aligned & positioned & activate tool to press the joint
Tag 1: Place jaw over the fitting, correctly aligned and positioned and activate tool to press the joint

Name: Tool should complete the correct cycle & the jaw ends should fully close on completion.
Tag 1: Tool should complete the correct cycle and the jaw ends should fully close on completion.

Name: If the tool does not complete the req. cycle during operation the fitting should be cut out, replaced then repressed
Tag 1: If the tool does not complete the required cycle during operation the fitting should be cut out, replaced then repressed.

Name: No fitting should be pressed more than once
Tag 1: No fitting should be pressed more than once

Name: Ensure appropriately coloured pipework is installed
Tag 1: Ensure appropriately coloured pipework is installed (Hot= Red, Cold= Black)

Name: Cut pipe cleanly & squarely using PE-X Pipe Cutters. Place beveled end of the sleeve facing outwards toward joint
Tag 1: Cut pipe cleanly and squarely using PE-X Pipe Cutters. Place beveled end of the sleeve facing outwards toward joint

Name: Expand the pipe twice only using the approved Expanding Tool
Tag 1: Expand the pipe twice only using the approved Expanding Tool

Name: Insert the fitting into the expanded end of the pipe until the fitting reaches the pipe stop
Tag 1: Insert the fitting into the expanded end of the pipe until the fitting reaches the pipe stop.

Name: Slide the jointing sleeve towards the fitting. Position the jointing sleeve & the fitting squarely within the jaws of the Compression Tool
Tag 1: Slide the jointing sleeve towards the fitting. Position the jointing sleeve and the fitting squarely within the jaws of the Compression Tool.

Name: Draw the sleeve towards the fitting by closing the jaws of the Compression Tool until the sleeve reaches the shoulder of the fitting
Tag 1: Draw the sleeve towards the fitting by closing the jaws of the Compression Tool until the sleeve reaches the shoulder of the fitting.

Name: Ensure pipework is not installed in the path of future fittings
Tag 1: Ensure pipework is not installed in the path of future fittings (sheeting screws, bathroom accessory fittings etc.)

Name: Where practical, arrange for pipework to be pre-cut & grooved off site
Tag 1: Where practical, arrange for pipework to be pre-cut and grooved off site

Name: Ensure pipe is cut squarely w/ a fit for purpose tool
Tag 1: Ensure pipe is cut squarely with a fit for purpose tool

Name: Assure manufactured roll grooved ends of pipework are measured for appropriate circumference using approved tape measure
Tag 1: Assure manufactured roll grooved ends of pipework are measured for appropriate circumference using approved tape measure

Name: Ensure pipe cut on-site is grooved to req. depth & check w/ approved tape measure
Tag 1: Ensure pipe cut on-site is grooved to required depth & check with approved tape measure

Name: Ensure pipe length is correct. Don't use coupling to pull incorrect pipe lengths together
Tag 1: Ensure pipe length is correct. Don't use coupling to pull incorrect pipe lengths together

Name: Lubricate & install inner coupling for connection of pipe & fittings, ensuring it is lapped over each connection point
Tag 1: Lubricate and install inner coupling for connection of pipe and fittings, ensuring it is lapped over each connection point

Name: tighten outer metal band gradually & evenly to a torque of the manufacturer's spec.
Tag 1: tighten outer metal band gradually and evenly to a torque of the manufacturer's specification

Name: Ensure a gap no more than 2 mm is evident on joining portions of outer coupling
Tag 1: Ensure a gap no more than 2 mm is evident on joining portions of outer coupling

Name: Inspect fitting/pipe after roll groove collar tightening to ensure it is square & aligned
Tag 1: Inspect fitting / pipe after roll groove collar tightening to ensure it is square and aligned

Tag 1: Photographic record to be kept of process. Take photos of gauges before and after

Tag 1: Pump test pipework to required kpa and time period as per AS 3500 & AS5601.1

Tag 1: For water test pipework to 1500 kpa for a period of not less than 30 mins. Ensure no air left in pipelines
